qas.question: What kind of garden is The Great Garden?
Who constructed the two pavilions in the palace?
Other than the Nouveau Jardin, what is the other popular part of The Great Garden?
What is at the centre of the Nouveau Jardin?
What kind of garden is the grand garden?
What was destroyed by axis bombing and currently under reconstruction?
What French artist designed the exterior?

plausible_answers.text: Great Ground and the Nouveau Jardin

qas.question: What are the two least popular areas of the garden?
What famous classical musician played at the historic garden theater?

context: The Great Garden is an important <a0_0><b5_0>European baroque garden<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <b6_0>The palace<b6_0/> itself, however, was largely destroyed by <a1_0>Allied bombing<a1_0/> but is currently under reconstruction.[citation needed] Some points of interest are the Grotto (the interior was designed by the French artist <b7_0>Niki de Saint-Phalle)<b7_0/>, the Gallery Building, the Orangerie and the two pavilions by <a2_0>Remy de la Fosse<a2_0/>. The Great Garden consists of several parts. The most popular ones are the <a3_0><b8_0>Great Ground<a3_0/> and the Nouveau Jardin<b8_0/>. At the centre of the Nouveau Jardin is <a4_0>Europe's highest garden fountain<a4_0/>. The historic Garden Theatre inter alia hosted the musicals of the German rock musician <b9_0>Heinz Rudolf Kunze.<b9_0/>[citation needed]
